Package Server.Signin

Contains sign in, registration, password reminder and password changing utilities for local sign in and implements OpenID sign in for Yahoo and Google account holders.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Account
    A generator to allow users access to their account information.
    AcctData
    Data object for user account information.
    AcctMngr
    Manages Account operations via FileDB.
    AnonSignin
    Allows anonymous signin for cases where user can accept no persistence of their data between sessions.
    FileDB
    Provides simple operations on a serialized file for storing and retrieving user account information.
    MD5
    Utilities for using MD5 digests to make unique 40 byte one way encryptions.
    OpenSignin
    A generator which implements sign in via OpenID.
    Password
    A generator which allows a signed in user to change thier password.
    SendMailSSL
    Based on sample code from http://www.mkyong.com/java/javamail-api-sending-email-via-gmail-smtp-example/ Requires the addition of mail.jar from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javamail/index.html The addition of mail.jar likely requires the removal of geronimo-spec-javamail-1.3.1-rc5.jar which comes in the cocoon 2.1.11 distribution as it collides with mail.jar.
    Signin
    A generator which implements sign in, registration, registration confirmation, and password reminder operations for local (non OpenID) signins.
    SigninXML
    Provides a common method for use by Signin, OpenSignin, and Signout to produce XML output for their respective XSLT conversions.
    Signout
    A generator which signs a user out of their account by clearing session information and returning the user to the Sign in page with messages appropriate to their session termination.
    Utils
    Miscellaneous utilities for Sign in and other operations.

Package Server.Signin Description

Contains sign in, registration, password reminder and password changing utilities for local sign in and implements OpenID sign in for Yahoo and Google account holders.
Version:
0.8, 12/15/2012
Author:
Frank Smutniak, Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, http://cdrh.unl.edu
